location: Another part of the same street, before the house of BRUTUS.

lines.text: Enter PORTIA and LUCIUS

lines.speaker: portia
lines.text: I prithee, boy, run to the senatehouse Stay not to answer me, but get thee gone: Why dost thou stay

lines.speaker: lucius
lines.text: To know my errand, madam.

lines.speaker: portia
lines.text: I would have had thee there, and here again, Ere I can tell thee what thou shouldst do there. O constancy, be strong upon my side, Set a huge mountain tween my heart and tongue! I have a mans mind, but a womans might. How hard it is for women to keep counsel! Art thou here yet

lines.speaker: lucius
lines.text: Madam, what should I do Run to the Capitol, and nothing else And so return to you, and nothing else

lines.speaker: portia
lines.text: Yes, bring me word, boy, if thy lord look well, For he went sickly forth: and take good note What Caesar doth, what suitors press to him. Hark, boy! what noise is that

lines.speaker: lucius
lines.text: I hear none, madam.

lines.speaker: portia
lines.text: Prithee, listen well I heard a bustling rumour, like a fray, And the wind brings it from the Capitol.

lines.speaker: lucius
lines.text: Sooth, madam, I hear nothing.
Enter the Soothsayer

lines.speaker: portia
lines.text: Come hither, fellow: which way hast thou been

lines.speaker: soothsayer
lines.text: At mine own house, good lady.

lines.speaker: portia
lines.text: What ist oclock

lines.speaker: soothsayer
lines.text: About the ninth hour, lady.

lines.speaker: portia
lines.text: Is Caesar yet gone to the Capitol

lines.speaker: soothsayer
lines.text: Madam, not yet: I go to take my stand, To see him pass on to the Capitol.

lines.speaker: portia
lines.text: Thou hast some suit to Caesar, hast thou not

lines.speaker: soothsayer
lines.text: That I have, lady: if it will please Caesar To be so good to Caesar as to hear me, I shall beseech him to befriend himself.

lines.speaker: portia
lines.text: Why, knowst thou any harms intended towards him

lines.speaker: soothsayer
lines.text: None that I know will be, much that I fear may chance. Good morrow to you. Here the street is narrow: The throng that follows Caesar at the heels, Of senators, of praetors, common suitors, Will crowd a feeble man almost to death: Ill get me to a place more void, and there Speak to great Caesar as he comes along.
Exit

lines.speaker: portia
lines.text: I must go in. Ay me, how weak a thing The heart of woman is! O Brutus, The heavens speed thee in thine enterprise! Sure, the boy heard me: Brutus hath a suit That Caesar will not grant. O, I grow faint. Run, Lucius, and commend me to my lord Say I am merry: come to me again, And bring me word what he doth say to thee.
Exeunt severally
